mdRecord.dcterms:title: Norumbega Castle, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jennings, Arthur Bates (American architect, 1849-1927) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Arthur Bates Jennings, architect. Random rubble, frame with shingling; 3 1/2 stories, irregular shape, gabled roof sections; broken skyline with stone stepped gable ends, semielliptical oriel with conical roof, and high chimneys; gabled entrance porch on stone piers with large lunette in gable, side and rear wrap-around porch, wing with decorative patterned shingling and open porte-cochere on 1st-floor level. Queen Anne. Rugged mansion built for Joseph B. Stearns, who became wealthy from invention of duplex telegraphy, by which 2 messages could be sent simultaneously over the same wire. Private; not accessible to the public. digitalcorpora.org/corp/nps/files/govdocs1/445/445357.pdf [work]
